summary: This is an email chain from March 6, 2019, regarding the logistics of transferring a large amount of data from the FBI to the Southern District of New York related to the Epstein case. An Assistant United States Attorney requests coordination between the recipient and the FBI case agent for uploading the data to a shared system.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting coordination for the transfer of FBI data on the Epstein case to a shared system. Works in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Case Data Transfer
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails to coordinate the logistics of transferring a large amount of FBI data on the Epstein case to a shared system, involving the FBI case agent.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI possessed a 'large amount of data' on the Epstein case as of March 2019.
The Southern District of New York was actively involved in the Epstein investigation and required the data to be uploaded to a shared system.
The email chain shows coordination between a federal prosecutor and an FBI case agent regarding evidence handling.
The document is a routine logistical email about evidence transfer, not containing substantive details of the case itself.
The correspondence date (March 6, 2019) is prior to Epstein's arrest in July 2019, indicating ongoing investigation.
